perturbation.original_text:
4.2
Invoices; Payments

The Suppliers shall issue invoices to the Company for any amounts payable to the Suppliers pursuant to this Agreement upon
shipment of the applicable Products to the Company. Payments for Products delivered in accordance with the Purchase Orders, and any other to be
made by the Company to Suppliers hereunder, shall be made in the Applicable Currency within [***]from the shipment of the applicable Products
delivered.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2
Invoices; Payments

The Suppliers shall issue invoices to the Company for any amounts payable to the Suppliers pursuant to this Agreement upon
shipment of the applicable Products to the Company. Payments for Products delivered in accordance with the Purchase Orders, and any other to be
made by the Company to Suppliers hereunder, shall be made in the Applicable Currency within [***] from the shipment of the applicable Products
delivered. However, for strategic partners, payments can be extended up to 90 days upon written approval from Photronics' CFO.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by adding a provision allowing for extended payment terms (up to 90 days) for 'strategic partners,' contradicting the original, more rigid payment deadline. This creates uncertainty about which payment deadline applies to which entities, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
2.2
Purchase Orders

The Suppliers will make good faith efforts to accept all [***]from the Company that comply with this Agreement including
adhering to all relevant specifications of the Product as set forth in the [***]entered into between the Company and the Supplier (including the
[***] (as defined below)). The Suppliers shall notify the Company of acceptance or rejection of a [***]within [***]hours of receipt of a [***].
Failure of the Suppliers to accept or reject a [***]within [***]hours shall constitute acceptance of such [***]. The lead time for the Products will be
as set forth in the applicable [***]. Each [***]shall include the following: (a) the Company’s [***]number; (b) identification of the quantity and
type of the Product ordered by the Company; (c) the price of each Product ordered per Schedule 2 attached hereto; (d) the requested delivery date
(subject to the applicable Product Lead Time); (e) any shipping instructions, including preferred carrier and shipping destination; and (f) the
specifications for the Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.2
Purchase Orders

The Suppliers will make good faith efforts to accept all [***]from the Company that comply with this Agreement including
adhering to all relevant specifications of the Product as set forth in the [***]entered into between the Company and the Supplier (including the
[***] (as defined below)). The Suppliers shall notify the Company of acceptance or rejection of a [***]within [***]hours of receipt of a [***].
Failure of the Suppliers to accept or reject a [***]within [***]hours shall constitute acceptance of such [***]. However, for critical orders as determined solely by DNP, the supplier's silence after 24 hours implies rejection of such [***]. The lead time for the Products will be
as set forth in the applicable [***]. Each [***]shall include the following: (a) the Company’s [***]number; (b) identification of the quantity and
type of the Product ordered by the Company; (c) the price of each Product ordered per Schedule 2 attached hereto; (d) the requested delivery date
(subject to the applicable Product Lead Time); (e) any shipping instructions, including preferred carrier and shipping destination; and (f) the
specifications for the Product.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states a default acceptance if no response within a timeframe. The modification adds an exception where for "critical orders as determined solely by DNP", the suppliers silence after 24 hours indicates rejection instead. This contradicts the original clause and introduces ambiguity for determining order acceptance.

perturbation.original_text:
7.2
Termination for Cause

A Party shall have the right to terminate its obligations under this Agreement if the other Party materially breaches this
Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after its receipt of written notice of the breach specifying such default.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.2
Termination for Cause

A Party shall have the right to terminate its obligations under this Agreement if the other Party materially breaches this
Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after its receipt of written notice of the breach specifying such default. However, Photronics shall have the right to terminate the agreement immediately if DNP's failure to meet quotas jeopardizes Photronic's key customer contracts, regardless of the 30-day cure period.
perturbation.explanation: This modification creates an in-text contradiction regarding the termination process. The original clause states a 30-day cure period for breaches before termination is allowed. The added clause provides an exception for Photronics, allowing immediate termination under specific circumstances (failure to meet quotas jeopardizing Photronic's customer contracts), effectively negating the 30-day cure period in those instances and causing enforcement uncertainty.
